metadata.title: CVE-2022-0185 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the way thelegacy_parse_param function in the Filesystem Context functionality of theLinux kernel verified the supplied parameters length. An unprivileged (incase of unprivileged user namespaces enabled, otherwise needs namespacedCAP_SYS_ADMIN privilege) local user able to open a filesystem that does notsupport the Filesystem Context API (and thus fallbacks to legacy handling)could use this flaw to escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
